docs.title: Neurogenomics KB
docs.text:
TOC: auto-generated

Owners: - Allison Eun Se You - Collaborators TBD

Scope: - Genetics foundation models - Brain foundation models - Multimodal integration anchored on UK Biobank

Contribution rules: - Keep PRs small; include references and cite upstream code/weights. - Mark unverifiable claims as TBD until reviewed. - Use datasets/ and schemas content as the single source of truth for columns/field IDs. - Add entries under docs/decisions for any tradeoffs or architectural calls.

docs.title: Governance & QC
docs.text:
• Eligibility criteria (UKB consent, imaging + genetics availability)
  • Exclusion rules (withdrawn, major QC flags, incomplete covariates)
  • Missingness tracking per table + imputation policy
  • Harmonization notes for imaging, genetics, and covariates
  • PII handling and secure storage (encrypted buckets, audit logging)
  • Data security (role-based access, key rotation, least privilege)

docs.title: UKB data map
docs.text:
Field ID placeholders (verify in extract): - Age: 21022 / 21003 - Sex: 31 - Income: 738 - Assessment center / site: 21054 or 54 - Genetics PCs: 22009 (pcs_1..10) - Imaging-derived phenotypes + confounds: FMRIB tables

Note: Instances follow UKB suffixes (e.g., -0.0 baseline vs -2.0 repeat imaging). Capture instance + visit metadata in schemas.

docs.title: Rationale
docs.text:
• Focus on covariates-only, brain-only, and late-fusion baselines to bound uplift from multimodal methods.
  • Use elastic net + CatBoost for speed, interpretability, and resilience with limited samples per site.
  • Deliver Nov 26 table to unblock alignment experiments.

docs.title: Open questions
docs.text:
• Do we freeze genetics encoders or permit lightweight fine-tuning for baselines?
  • How do we handle class imbalance for MDD vs cognition tasks within GroupKFold?
  • Should we reserve a calibration set distinct from validation folds?

docs.title: Rationale
docs.text:
• Prioritize CLIP-style contrastive alignment + gradient reversal for site invariance.
  • Maintain Deep CCA variant as interpretable backup for regulators.
  • Stage experiments: pretrain embeddings → align → downstream finetune.

docs.title: Open questions
docs.text:
• Which modality pairings get highest priority (whole-genome vs exome, structural vs functional)?
  • Do we enforce shared latent dimension across all models or allow per-task projections?
  • How strict should site-robustness penalties be before harming accuracy?

docs.title: Datasets
docs.text:
• UK Biobank
  • Targets: MDD (Howard et al.) and cognition (TBD task list)

docs.title: Metrics & reporting
docs.text:
• AUC, PR-AUC, Brier score
  • Calibration curves + subgroup reporting with confidence intervals

docs.title: Early fusion
docs.text:
• Merge genetics + brain embeddings before task head
  • Risk: modality imbalance and overfitting

docs.title: Shared latent space
docs.text:
• Project modalities into common latent prior to prediction
  • Risk: difficult interpretability

docs.title: Cross-modal transformer
docs.text:
• Alternating attention layers across modalities
  • Risk: high compute/VRAM

docs.title: Staged pretraining
docs.text:
• Pretrain per modality, freeze, then fine-tune joint layers
  • Risk: stale frozen encoders

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
• CLIP-style contrastive alignment between gene and brain embeddings (InfoNCE)
  • Deep CCA variant for downstream linear alignment
  • Site-robustness via gradient reversal layers

docs.title: Evaluation plan
docs.text:
• Linear probe over frozen aligned representations
  • Fine-tune end-to-end for key targets after probe sanity checks

docs.title: Baselines
docs.text:
• Covariates-only models
  • Brain-only models
  • Late fusion (covariates + brain)
  • Algorithms: logistic regression (elastic net) and CatBoost

docs.title: Deliverable
docs.text: • Nov 26 baseline results table shared in README + dashboards

docs.title: NeuroMamba
docs.text:
Short summary: state-space inspired spatiotemporal model for whole-brain signals (verify official repo/paper).

Links: - Repo: TBD (verify official source) - Paper: TBD

docs.title: Architecture overview
docs.text: Swin-style 3D/4D backbone adapted for fMRI volumes, with temporal attention for BOLD sequences.

docs.title: Expected inputs
docs.text:
• Preprocessed BOLD volumes (subject-session)
  • Optional mask/confound channels as additional tokens

docs.title: Inference plan
docs.text:
• Produce subject-level embeddings via windowed pooling
  • Aggregate across sessions before downstream prediction

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Evo 2 foundation model for DNA. Long-context sequence modeling with a hybrid architecture pretrained on large genomes.

docs.text:

python scripts/run_evo2.py --config configs/evo2.yaml
